name: 張文中
objective:
To acquire mathematical tools for analyzing linear systems:
Mathematical Descriptions of Systems, Background Linear Algebra, State-Space Solutions and Realizations, Stability, Controllability and Observability, Minimal Realizations and Coprime Fractions, State Feedback and State Estimators, Pole Placement
schedule:
Week     Topic
1. Introduction
2. Background linear algebra
3. Mathematical descriptions of systems
4. Linearization
5. State-space solutions
6. Realizations
7. Stability of LTI systems
8. Lyapunov theorem
9. Midterm exam
10. Controllability
11. Observability
12. Coprime fractions
13. Presentations
14. Minimal realizations
15. State feedback
16. State estimators
17. Pole placement
18. Final exam
scorePolicy: The final grade will be a weighted average of homework (including quizzes) 20%, midterm 25%, presentation (including report) 25%, and final examination 30%.
materials: Linear System Theory and Design - Fourth Edition, Chi-Tsong Chen, Oxford University Press, 2012
